Venusaur.overview: Venusaur's Ability in Chlorophyll, great coverage, and access to powerful residual damage with G-Max Vine Lash make it a top non-Restricted Pokemon in the VGC 2022 metagame. Venusaur also has access to fast Sleep Powder which can shut down much of the metagame. Groudon is commonly its partner in crime as its Drought sets sun activating Venusaur's Chlorophyll. Groudon also patches up Venusaur's Fire-type weakness against Pokemon such as Incineroar and Rotom-H, and Venusaur, in turn, checks Water-types such as Kyogre and Tapu Fini. However, Groudon and Venusaur share common weaknesses to Pokemon such as Kyurem-W and Calyrex-I, so Zacian-C is a good partner to check these Pokemon better.

sets.name: Chlorophyll Attacker
sets.description:
• Leaf Storm OHKOes Pokemon such as Groudon and Gastrodon and heavily dents Kyogre. When Dynamaxed, it becomes G-Max Vine Lash, which puts on even bigger pressure with its residual damage, able to finish off weakened opponents or Pokemon that rely on Focus Sash. Frenzy Plant provides a stronger G-Max Vine Lash with the downside of being less flexible outside of Dynamax.

  • Weather Ball is used in conjunction with Groudon or Torkoal's Drought, becoming a powerful coverage move against opposing Steel-types. It turns into Max Flare under Dynamax, allowing Venusaur to OHKO Zacian-C with Life Orb and hit opposing Venusaur extremely hard.

  • Earth Power is used to hit Incineroar and Zacian-C super effectively without relying on Weather Ball for the latter. It turns into Max Quake under Dynamax and boosts Venusaur's and its ally's Special Defense, letting it better take on strong special attackers such as Dialga and Palkia. Sludge Bomb hits Grimmsnarl and boosts Venusaur's Special Attack under Dynamax via Max Ooze.

  • Sleep Powder is used to nullify threats and can potentially give Venusaur the upper hand in unfavorable matchups.

  • A Modest nature is preferred because Venusaur does not need to outpace Regieleki under sun; however, a Timid nature can be used to grant it this luxury.

  • With Life Orb, Venusaur can severely dent opposing teams with G-Max Vine Lash. The boost also allows it to OHKO Zacian-C with Max Flare and 2HKO Assault Vest Incineroar with Max Quake. Coba Berry protects Venusaur from the metagame's various Max Airstream users such as Landorus-T and Yveltal. Focus Sash allows Venusaur to survive one hit from Pokemon like Calyrex-S and Kyurem-W, letting it support teammates such as Groudon and Charizard with Sleep Powder when it doesn't want to Dynamax.

sets.name: Gigantamax
sets.description: Charizard is one of the strongest Pokemon in VGC 2022; under Groudon's sun, it obliterates nearly everything. It also easily snowballs with Max Airstream, and has good matchups into many common Pokemon like Zacian-C, Rillaboom, and Amoonguss. G-Max Wildfire's incredible residual damage sets up teammates like Groudon, Zacian-C, and Regieleki to sweep. Blast Burn and Hurricane give Charizard the strongest possible G-Max Wildfire and Max Airstream. Charizard's Max Airstream is a very potent snowballing tool and supports its team with Speed boosts. Heat Wave grants Charizard a great spread attack for when it's not Gigantamaxed, as Hurricane is inaccurate and Blast Burn has a recharge turn. Ancient Power allows Charizard to OHKO opposing non-Charti Berry Charizard via Max Rockfall. Solar Beam is used to OHKO the common Gastrodon with Max Overgrowth, and with Life Orb, it can even KO a chipped Kyogre. Life Orb makes Charizard nuclear, achieving feats like OHKOing physically defensive Incineroar, Dynamaxed Zapdos, and Assault Vest Yveltal. Charti Berry lets Charizard survive Rock-type moves such as Max Rockfall from Groudon, Landorus-T, and opposing Charizard. Lum Berry protects Charizard against status moves like Venusaur's Sleep Powder and Grimmsnarl's Thunder Wave.

Zapdos.overview: Zapdos storms into the VGC 2022 metagame as one of the strongest special-attacking Dynamax options in the format. Electric / Flying typing is incredibly effective for both defensive and offensive purposes. It gives Zapdos key resistances or immunities to some of the strongest attacks in the metagame—like Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade and Groudon's Precipice Blades—alongside almost perfect neutral STAB coverage, access to STAB Max Airstream, and STAB super effective moves for top Pokemon like Kyogre, Amoonguss, and Venusaur. Zapdos has a strong niche on Kyogre and Zacian-C teams, as both Pokemon appreciate Zapdos's Max Airstream to quickly fire off their devastating attacks, as well as Zapdos hitting opposing Kyogre and Grass-types for heavy damage. However, Zapdos is fairly limited if it is not used as a Dynamax option, and it can have problems with certain matchups. It struggles when teams can weaken it with Light Screen and/or Snarl, or when they negate its Max Airstream boosts with speed control of their own.

sets.name: Dynamax Attacker
sets.description:
• Thunderbolt as a primary attack offers consistent damage outside of Dynamax and a strong Max Lightning within Dynamax.

  • Hurricane offers Zapdos a very strong STAB Max Airstream, boosting the Speed of it and its ally, and offering super effective damage against common Pokemon like Amoonguss and Venusaur. However, its low accuracy can be a hinderance outside of Dynamax.

  • Heat Wave is typically the third attack to deal heavy damage with Max Flare to tough Steel-types like Ferrothorn, Solgaleo, and most importantly Zacian-C. Given how often Zapdos is paired with Kyogre, Weather Ball can potentially give Zapdos a way to hit Incinieroar and other Fire- or Ground-types. Also, when Zapdos is with Groudon or facing it, Weather Ball can offer a stronger and more consistent Fire-type attack. However, Weather Ball is overall less consistent and relies on bringing a weather setter alongside Zapdos.

  • Life Orb is Zapdos's most common item, maximizing its damage to rip through teams with very powerful Max Moves. Safety Goggles is an alternative that allows Zapdos to better deal with Amoonguss and Venusaur by ignoring their powder moves.

  • The given EV spread allows Zapdos, when Dynamaxed, to always survive a Modest Mystic Water Kyogre Max Geyser based off Water Spout. It and the Timid nature also maximize Speed to potentially win Speed ties against base 100s like Charizard and opposing Zapdos. A Modest nature instead increases its damage output at the cost of being outsped by Timid Kyogre and Dialga.

Kyogre.overview:
Kyogre is one of the most devastating Restricted Pokemon available in VGC 2022 thanks to its high Special Attack, supported by Drizzle boosting its Water-type moves, superb natural bulk, and access to two powerful spread moves in Water Spout and Origin Pulse. It has naturally strong matchups into the majority of the metagame, with standouts including Incineroar, Zacian-C, Landorus-T, and Groudon. Its base 90 Speed also leaves it in a wonderful spot, as Kyogre can operate under almost any speed control, with faster sets working well under Tailwind and Max Airstream support from Tornadus, Thundurus, and Zapdos, while slower, bulkier sets thrive under Trick Room from Calyrex-I, Mimikyu, and Porygon2. Not all goes swimmingly for Kyogre, however; VGC 2022's abundance of viable Electric-types in Regieleki, Thundurus, and Zapdos and Kyogre's centralizing nature means it has a large target on its back at all times. Grass-types like Venusaur, Amoonguss, Rillaboom, and Ferrothorn can also sponge its Water- and Electric-type attacks and threaten it back.

For Kyogre users looking to avoid these pitfalls, pair it with Grass- and Ground- types like Amoonguss, Landorus-T, and Venusaur, which works well even when not used alongside Groudon, to help check the Electric-types. Teammates like Incineroar, Zapdos, and Tornadus can help put pressure on Grass-type foes. Kyogre's damage output is severely limited by damage reduction like Light Screen and Snarl, as well as ways to override rain like Groudon's Drought or Calyrex-I's Max Hailstorm. Kyogre can reverse these overrides with Max Geyser to reset its rain, however. Pokemon like Palkia, Lapras, and Gastrodon can completely wall Kyogre; to muscle past these, Kyogre should look to teammates like Play Rough Zacian-C, Regieleki, or Energy Ball Amoonguss.
Kyogre.comments:
Other Options

Kyogre can run Assault Vest to better stand up to the likes of Regieleki, Calyrex-S, and opposing Kyogre by greatly improving its special bulk. As a result, however, it's always left vulnerable to any attack, and will have to Dynamax to avoid being stopped by Fake Out. Weakness Policy punishes Electric- and Grass-type attacks looking to beat down Kyogre by sharply raising its Special Attack, giving it the ability to OHKO the likes of Dynamax Venusaur and Thundurus in retaliation. Scald can be used in place of Origin Pulse for perfect accuracy and the chance to burn, but deals considerably less damage overall. A Calm Mind + Leftovers set can be used without Water Spout, allowing Kyogre to afford more bulk and Speed investment while still hitting hard with Origin Pulse or Max Geyser.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• When Kyogre is at full HP, it should be using Water Spout in almost all cases, as the devastatingly strong and perfectly accurate attack is capable of OHKOing Zacian-C and Calyrex-S with ease at full power. Water Spout also serves as the base for Kyogre's Max Geyser, a powerful single target attack not reliant on its HP. Origin Pulse makes for a suitable alternate Water attack, as it also offers strong spread damage, though its shaky accuracy can be worrying.

  • Thunder lets Kyogre hit opposing Water-types like Lapras, Blastoise, and other Kyogre for super effective damage. It can also use Max Lightning, which sets Electric Terrain, powering up subsequent Electric attacks and keeping it safe from Amoonguss's Spore. Ice Beam allows it to hit Grass-types for super effective damage as well as Palkia, Dialga, and Kyurem-W neutrally, though Max Hailstorm's effect of replacing rain with hail isn't nearly as useful in most cases.

  • Mystic Water is Kyogre's best boosting item, since, unlike Choice Specs, it allows Kyogre to change moves and, unlike Life Orb, it doesn't drain any of its HP, crucial for keeping its Water Spout consistently strong. However, Life Orb makes Kyogre a monumental threat when Dynamaxed, giving it the strongest possible Max Geyser and boosting its other moves as well.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• Water Spout is Kyogre's go-to move at full health, easily OHKOing Incineroar, Regieleki, and Calyrex-S. Should Kyogre need to Dynamax, it also provides the strongest possible Max Geyser.

  • Origin Pulse is Kyogre's best backup Water move thanks to its high power and spread damage, becoming stronger than Water Spout once Kyogre is at 72% HP or less.

  • Thunder and Ice Beam provide Kyogre with excellent coverage, with Thunder hitting Pokemon resistant to Water such as Lapras and opposing Kyogre, while Ice Beam can hit Grass-types like Amoonguss and Venusaur, as well as Gastrodon, which is immune to its other attacks.

  • Choice Scarf allows Kyogre to outspeed Zacian-C and Calyrex-S without the need for any additional speed control, though a Timid nature is required to do this. Do note that Kyogre cannot outspeed Regieleki even with a Choice Scarf, so it will still need support to check it.

Groudon.overview: VGC 22 is overrun by Zacian-C, Incineroar, and Regieleki, which all have one thing in common: a key weakness to Ground. Additionally, Kyogre's rain-boosted Water Spout makes it one of the most threatening Restricted Pokemon options available. Thankfully, we have Groudon, an offensive behemoth with a vital defensive niche thanks to the combination of Drought, excellent natural bulk, and Ground-typing, making it a great answer to all of the aforementioned Pokemon and more Groudon functions well with or without Dynamax, having the option to fire off spread Precipice Blades and gradually chip down opponents or launch single-targeted Max Quakes, boosting its Special Defense and packing a massive punch. Its wide range of coverage moves, including Fire Punch, Shadow Claw, and Rock Tomb, make it very customizable and allow for a variety of sets. Groudon is not without its faults, however, such as it relies on the shaky 85% accuracy of Precipice Blades and is at a disadvantage trying to win the weather against Kyogre. It also often has to give up Dynamaxing in favor of teammates like Charizard, Venusaur, and Thundurus, which significantly cuts into its offensive pressure.
Groudon.comments:
Team Options

Zacian-C: Zacian-C checks numerous Pokemon that Groudon doesn't appreciate like Calyrex-I and Kartana. More importantly, it acts as a reliable and fast partner that can put pressure on opposing Dynamaxed Pokemon.

Lunala: Lunala provides Trick Room support and a way to damage Incineroar and Flying-types with Meteor Beam, allowing it to provide support and offensive coverage to Groudon.

Thundurus: As Groudon is susceptible to Intimidate, Defiant Thundurus does a great job of pressuring the likes of Incineroar and Landorus-T off the field.

Gigantamax Venusaur and Charizard: These are two of the most prominent benefactors of Groudon's Drought in the metagame. Venusaur can outspeed the entire unboosted metagame in sun and fire off Sleep Powders or G-Max Vinelash, while Charizard has access to insanely strong G-Max Wildfires thanks to Solar Power.

Incineroar and Gastrodon: Incineroar's Parting Shot and Gastrodon's Storm Drain are vital to helping Groudon win the weather war against Kyogre. They also help to check Pokemon like Landorus-T and Zacian-C.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description:
• Precipice Blades, despite the accuracy concerns, is still Groudon's most effective way to deal damage. When Dynamaxed, Groudon can use Max Quake to boost its Special Defense, which is hugely effective in tandem with Assault Vest.

  • Stone Edge is a strong option for hitting Pokemon immune to Ground like Thundurus, Charizard, and Yveltal, but Rock Tomb can be used to support Groudon's teammates by slowing down foes. Stone Edge also has the stronger Max Rockfall at 130 BP compared to Rock Tomb's 110.

  • Fire Punch lets Groudon deal consistent Fire-type damage, as Heat Crash will fail against a Dynamaxed foe and does less damage to Zacian-C. Heat Crash, however, does more damage against most other non-Dynamaxed foes thanks to Groudon's weight stat, including getting the OHKO on Amoonguss.

  • Shadow Claw lets Groudon OHKO Calyrex-S and do big damage to Lunala. Heavy Slam hits Grimmsnarl and provides Max Steelspike, giving it access to both defense-boosting Max Moves. Giga Impact is used for Max Strike, slowing down foes and keeping them in check for partners like Charizard, Zacian-C, and Calyrex-S.

  • Assault Vest is massive for giving Groudon a leg up against special attackers; Kyogre, Calyrex-S, and Charizard all have a much harder time breaking through Groudon with additional Special Defense.

sets.name: Attack Booster
sets.description:
• Precipice Blades is Groudon's best Ground-type move and deals spread damage without threatening its partner. Max Quake can help Groudon by giving it Special Defense boosts to better matchup against Calyrex-S and Kyogre.

  • Rock Slide hits many common Pokemon immune to Ground like Charizard and Thundurus, and can deal significant damage when Groudon has boosted Attack. Rock Tomb, while significantly less threatening offensively, can be a great help for its partners like Yveltal and Lunala, allowing them to outspeed the faster Pokemon like Thundurus, Zacian-C, and Calyrex-S.

  • Swords Dance is Groudon's best way at counteracting Intimidate from Incineroar and Landorus-T. Bulk Up is slower to boost its Attack, but the Defense boost can help against physical attackers, such as making Zacian-C's +1 Behemoth Blade a guaranteed 3HKO and instantly garnering an advantage in Groudon wars. At +1 Attack, it can OHKO 252 HP / 4 Defense Zacian-C.

  • Sitrus Berry and Leftovers provide Groudon with slight HP recovery which goes a long way to improve its longevity, but White Herb helps cancel out Intimidate drops as well as some annoying drops from Max Moves like opposing Max Wyrmwind, Max Phantasm, and Max Darkness.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: Gastrodon is the best check to Kyogre in the metagame; since Storm Drain and its Ground typing leave it immune to any Water- and Electric-type attacks, Kyogre can virtually only hit it with Ice Beam, Hyper Beam, and these moves' Max Moves. Gastrodon's solid bulk also means it matches up strongly against many other common Pokemon, like Zacian-C (especially ones without Play Rough), Incineroar, and Regieleki. It opts not to use a Water-type move, as Earth Power and Ice Beam already cover every Pokemon it would need to hit such as Incineroar, Landorus-T, Rillaboom, and Amoonguss. Gastrodon can also make a good situational Dynamax user in matches where it isn't scared of Grass-type moves, firing off Max Quakes to bolster its already respectable Special Defense. Yawn helps check opposing Dynamax users because, when timed correctly, they'll be forced to switch out or fall asleep without making full use of their Dynamax turns. Protect complements Yawn, stalling out the second turn necessary for the foe to fall asleep, and can temporarily keep Gastrodon safe from Grass-type moves and other powerful attacks. The EV spread allows Gastrodon to survive two Play Roughs from +1 Zacian-C, after a Protect in between, thanks to Leftovers recovery. Using 8 Speed IVs allows Gastrodon to underspeed Calyrex-I, which is vital to checking it under Trick Room.

Dialga.overview: Dialga is a sturdy cannon in the VGC 2022 metagame, able to check common Restricted Pokemon like Kyogre, Calyrex-I, and Zacian-C. It is a great Dynamax Pokemon on hyper offense, as it can stack up defensive boosts via Max Steelspike and Max Quake for itself and its partners like Zacian-C and 2HKO or even OHKO nearly the whole metagame. Focus Sash Grimmsnarl is ideal support for Dialga, as it can utilize Fake Out, Fake Tears, and Scary Face to make Dialga effectively impossible to handle without taking serious damage across the entire team. This sets up its most common Restricted Pokemon partner in Zacian-C to clean through opposing teams which are on their last legs. Unfortunately, Dialga can struggle against some sun teams which contain threats like Groudon and Charizard, so Kyogre and Landorus-T also make for good partners.
Dialga.comments:
Other Options

Dialga can use Draco Meteor for more flexibility outside of Dynamax, but the fact that Draco Meteor drops Dialga's Special Attack and Dialga often wants to Dynamax anyway makes Roar of Time generally superior.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Roar of Time gives Dialga the strongest possible Max Wyrmwind and comes with the added benefit of dropping the Attack stats of Pokemon such as Groudon and Zacian-C. This is particularly effective as Dialga will usually Dynamax, avoiding the recharge turn.

  • Flash Cannon gives Dialga the ability to hit Fairy-types such as Grimmsnarl hard and also gives itself and its partners Defense boosts under Dynamax via Max Steelspike.

  • Earth Power lets Dialga hit Incineroar and Steel-types such as Zacian-C and also boosts Dialga's Special Defense under Dynamax via Max Quake.

  • Trick Room allows Dialga to bypass its relatively low Speed and can help against the metagame's many faster Pokemon like Zacian-C, Calyrex-S, and Timid Kyogre. Blizzard alternatively OHKOes Landorus-T through Dynamax and Amoonguss via Max Hailstorm. Max Lightning OHKOes Gigantamaxed Charizard and hits Water-types like Kyogre and Tapu Fini harder.

  • The given Special Attack investment along with the Modest Nature hits a stat bump. The Speed allows it to outrun Calyrex-S after Grimmsnarl's Scary Face and the rest is poured into bulk.

  • Life Orb gives Dialga more immediate damage allowing it to OHKO the commonplace Incineroar with both Max Wyrmwind and Max Quake and other bulky Pokemon such as Gastrodon with Max Wyrmwind and Zacian-C with Max Quake.

Whimsicott.overview: Whimsicott's Prankster Tailwind and lightning-fast playstyle make it a perfect choice for hyper offense teams, particularly those featuring Calyrex-S as a Restricted Pokemon. Due to the combination of Prankster and its high base Speed of 116, Whimsicott is the most reliable Tailwind setter in the metagame, making it a crucial pick for those that rely on moving first. It also comes armed with a bevy of support moves which allow it to fill all kinds of niches that very specific teams or cores may require, like fast Taunt, Sunny Day, or even the dreaded Switcheroo + Eject Button combo to disrupt opposing Dynamax users. Its Fairy-type attacks also pressure Dark-types like Yveltal and Grimmsnarl that are often used to counter Calyrex-S. However, Whimsicott does have glaring flaws; first and foremost, fast Tailwind is utterly ruined if the opponent is able to set up Trick Room. It also has to worry about being stopped in its tracks by Fake Out. Whimsicott's offensive presence is generally middling, so it relies on the power of partners like Calyrex-S, Kyogre, Kartana, and Regieleki to deal damage, often supported by its Helping Hand. This is a double-edged sword, however, as if its partner goes down during the turn, both it and its partner's efforts are effectively wasted.
Whimsicott.comments:
Other Options

Coba Berry is helpful for allowing Whimsicott to survive a Max Airstream if your team's Focus Sash is already taken; however, this makes Whimsicott much easier to KO. Encore is useful for locking opponents into unfavorable moves like Protect and Trick Room, but optimal conditions don't always come up for it to be used, and it can be blocked by Psychic Terrain. Sunny Day can be used in its last moveslot to help check Kyogre, but Protect is generally more useful. Other speed control options like Trick Room and Cotton Spore can also turn the tables in Tailwind mirror matches.

sets.name: Prankster Support
sets.description:
• Moonblast is Whimsicott's best option for single-target damage, but spread Dazzling Gleam allows Whimsicott to put more damage on the board as a whole. Energy Ball can be used on Kyogre teams as a means to hit Gastrodon.

  • Prankster Tailwind is nearly guaranteed to go up, making Whimsicott a vital component of hyper offense teams where speed is everything.

  • Helping Hand is a universally beneficial way for Whimsicott to boost its ally's offensive pressure instead of relying on its relatively weak Fairy coverage.

  • Taunt can disrupt the opponent's attempts to counter Whimsicott such as Trick Room and opposing Tailwind.

  • Focus Sash preserves Whimsicott for a future Tailwind or Helping Hand support, as its middling defenses leave it OHKOed by the majority of the metagame's attacks otherwise.

Amoonguss.overview: With access to Spore, Rage Powder, and Regenerator, Amoonguss acts as a great support Pokemon on teams that take advantage of the free turns that it provides through redirection and status. Amoonguss's low Speed also makes it one of the strongest Trick Room checks in VGC 2022, as once Trick Room is set up, it can move before almost every common Pokemon and put them to sleep with Spore. Amoonguss is often paired with some of the most potent Restricted Pokemon in the metagame like Zacian-C, Kyogre, and Palkia due to its ability to buy extra turns for them and them checking threats to it like Incineroar and Rotom-H. However, a few prominent weaknesses prevent Amoonguss from being a complete menace to the format. Pokemon like Incineroar, Rotom-H, and Zapdos deal heavy damage to Amoonguss and commonly use Safety Goggles to be immune to Spore and Rage Powder. Amoonguss also has a glaring weakness to Max Airstream—one of the most common Max Moves used in the format. Amoonguss can also simply be OHKOed by powerful attackers like Charizard, Calyrex-I, and Calyrex-S before they Dynamax.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• Spore is an incredibly powerful move in VGC 2022due to its ability to incapacitate an opponent's Dynamaxed or Restricted Pokemon for multiple turns, which can massively swing the momentum of battles.

  • Rage Powder is a staple move in Doubles, allowing Amoonguss to use its high bulk to shield its partner from attacks.

  • Pollen Puff heals allies, which is especially effective when opposing Pokemon are asleep. Pollen Puff also ensures that Amoonguss isn't completely neutralized by Taunt, breaks potential Focus Sashes, and chips in for small amounts of damage. However, teams that have difficulty dealing with bulky Water-type Pokemon like Gastrodon may opt to use Giga Drain to chunk them down and provide some recovery to Amoonguss.

  • Coba Berry is Amoonguss's primary item due to the ubiquity of Max Airstream in VGC 2022, allowing it to survive the move from Pokemon like Landorus-T and Thundurus and put them to sleep or provide further Rage Powder support for its allies. Alternatively, Focus Sash trades the ability to potentially survive multiple other attacks after a Max Airstream for the ability to survive a plethora of super effective Max Moves and other powerful moves such as Expanding Force from Calyrex-S.

  • The given EV spread allows Amoonguss to always survive a Behemoth Blade from maximum Attack Zacian-C, with the rest of the EVs being used to maximize Special Defense. 27 Speed IVs ensure that Amoonguss is slower than minimum Speed Calyrex-I, allowing Amoonguss to move before it under Trick Room and use Spore while also allowing Amoonguss to outspeed and use Spore on Torkoal outside of Trick Room.

sets.name: Prankster Tailwind
sets.description: Tornadus is a very simple Pokemon with a clear objective: it clicks Prankster Tailwind. This is most popularly used to enable Pokemon like Kyogre and Calyrex-S, allowing them to hit hard and fast with their strong spread moves like Water Spout and Astral Barrage. When it comes to supporting Kyogre, it and Whimsicott are effectively as good as each other, but there are a few reasons why one would use Tornadus for this role over Whimsicott, the first being its stronger offensive presence. Tornadus's Hurricane is perfectly accurate when paired with Kyogre's rain, and it's able to pressure Grass-types like Rillaboom, Venusaur, and Kartana, which Whimsicott fails to do. Tornadus can also act as a Dynamax user in desperate situations and fire off powerful Max Airstreams to continue boosting its Speed. Icy Wind is another vital tool in the Speed race; it can slow down foes and potentially allow Tornadus to delay using Tailwind by a turn, which can make all the difference in fast-paced Tailwindversus Tailwind matchups. Protect and Focus Sash are both chosen to help Tornadus's longevity, as the more moves it can use to gain a Speed advantage for its team, the better. Mental Herb can be useful against opposing Tailwind structures, however, to circumvent a Taunt or Encore from opposing Whimsicott.

Thundurus.overview: Thundurus is one of the strongest Dynamax users in VGC 2022. Defiant can punish pertinent Intimidate Pokemon in Incineroar and Landorus-T, and it has access to an assortment of good Max Moves to support its team, particularly Max Airstream. These attributes make Thundurus a phenomenal pairing alongside the metagame's best Restricted Pokemon such as Zacian-C and Calyrex-S. However, Defiant Thundurus isn't very strong, and it can struggle against teams with dual screens Grimmsnarl and bulky Pokemon like Gastrodon, Groudon, and Zacian-C. Moreover, Defiant Thundurus's reliance on Dynamax can make it difficult to justify bringing alongside other Pokemon reliant on Dynamaxing. Thundurus can also run an support set with valuable Prankster speed control and Eerie Impulse to severely hinder common special attackers like Kyogre, Zapdos, and Calyrex-S. Support Thundurus weakening many special attackers makes it pair well with a variety of Pokemon; Kyogre appreciates Thundurus weakening Venusaur and Regieleki, and Zacian-C and Groudon appreciate Kyogre and Zapdos being weakened. However, Prankster Thundurus faces tough competition from Prankster Grimmsnarl, which can help defend against both physical and special attackers with Prankster dual screens. It's also Dark-type, which makes it immune to Prankster Taunt from Thundurus and Whimsicott, as well as a more adequate Calyrex-S check.
Thundurus.comments:
Other Options

Lum Berry can be run on offensive Thundurus to protect it against status moves like Amoonguss's and Venusaur's sleep moves. Superpower is an option over Brick Break that OHKOes Incineroar after a Defiant boost. Iron Tail gives Thundurus Max Steelspike to boost its Defense, helping against Zacian, and OHKO Grimmsnarl without Reflect.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Fly grants Thundurus access to Max Airstream for boosting its team's Speed, which can quickly let the metagame's strongest Restricted Pokemon like Zacian-C, Calyrex-S, and Kyogre snowball.

  • Brick Break gives Thundurus Max Knuckle for boosting its team's Attack, and it breaks Grimmsnarl's dual screens.

  • Crunch and Foul Play give Thundurus access to Max Darkness, which hits Lunala hard, and Max Darkness lowering Special Defense can assist teammates like Kyogre and Calyrex-S. Crunch allows Thundurus to OHKO Calyrex-S outside of Dynamax. Alternatively, Foul Play gives Thundurus more damage against Solgaleo and Calyrex-I, especially if they've already activated Weakness Policy.

  • Life Orb helps Thundurus with its otherwise meager power, allowing it to 2HKO Zacian-C and Gastrodon in Dynamax guaranteed, and the same for Grimmsnarl in Reflect. Alternatively, Assault Vest helps Thundurus take hits from special attackers like Kyogre, Calyrex-S, and Zapdos.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• Thunder Wave is invaluable speed control, permanently slowing down most of the metagame.

  • Eerie Impulse greatly weakens the metagame's many Special Attackers like Kyogre, Venusaur, and Calyrex-S.

  • Taunt shuts down status moves like Amoonguss's and Venusaur's powder moves, Gastrodon's Yawn, and Calyrex-S's Will-O-Wisp. Alternatively, Scary Face gives Thundurus speed control against Ground- and Electric-types like Regieleki, Zapdos, and Landorus-T, which are immune to Thunder Wave. Scary Face could be used as Thundurus's sole means of speed control for an extra moveslot, though Thunder Wave's full paralysis chance and permanence are hard to pass up on.

  • Sitrus Berry simply improves longevity, while Safety Goggles gives Thundurus immunity to Venusaur's and Amoonguss's powder moves.

  • The given EV spread survives Zacian-C's Play Rough and slightly optimizes Special Defense.

Landorus-Therian.overview: Landorus-T stands out as VGC 2022's best non-Restricted Ground-type attacker, an important role in a metagame dominated by Incineroar, Zacian-C, Regieleki, and many more Pokemon weak to Ground. Intimidate and Fly, for Max Airstream, are both great for its utility. These tools make it a popular check to Groudon and Venusaur cores, as it can hit Venusaur hard and stand up well to almost anything Groudon can throw at it. If it can successfully set up a Swords Dance, it can also sweep entire teams with a well-timed Dynamax. However, Landorus-T is very, very reliant on Dynamax to get much accomplished, as Fly is nearly useless on its own, and Earthquake and Rock Slide are relatively weak without several Attack boosts, so plan accordingly and be careful when bringing Landorus-T with another Pokemon reliant on Dynamax. Landorus-T also struggles against the metagame's numerous Water- and Ice-types like Kyogre, Kyurem-W, Calyrex-I, and Lapras, which can OHKO it even while it's Dynamaxed. Therefore, partners like Zacian-C and Regieleki are vital to ensuring it can sweep effectively.
Landorus-Therian.comments:
Other Options

Landorus-T can run Protect over Swords Dance on Life Orb sets to be safer while not Dynamaxed, but this leaves it without a way to boost its Attack, and thus much more vulnerable to Intimidate. Earth Power can be used on Life Orb sets over Earthquake on teams with Rillaboom, circumventing damage reductions from Grassy Terrain and Intimidate, but this means Max Quake will come off of its much weaker Special Attack. In this case, Swords Dance can still be replaced with Protect. Assault Vest can also be used to boost Landorus-T's special bulk, making it better against Calyrex-S and Hyper Beam Regieleki, but this set is more susceptible to Intimidate with the lack of White Herb and Swords Dance.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
• While Earthquake might seem appealing as Landorus-T's strongest Ground move, its main appeal is in the form of Earthquake's main appeal isn't as a standalone STAB move but as a base for a powerful Max Quake, dealing which deals massive damage to even neutral targets like Kyogre, easily OHKOing OHKOes Pokemon weak to Ground like Zacian-C and Regieleki, and boosting its boosts Landorus-T's Special Defense, furthering its longevity.

  • Fly is used to grant grants Landorus-T access to Max Airstream, vital for boosting its and its partner's Speed, as well as pressuring Grass-types like Venusaur, Rillaboom, and Amoonguss.

  • Rock Slide is Landorus-T's best coverage option, notably hitting Flying-types like Zapdos, Thundurus, and Yveltal, but also enabling weather control with Max Rockfall if necessary.

  • Swords Dance is vital for allowing Landorus-T to sweep and counteract Intimidate from Incineroar and opposing Landorus-T.

  • White Herb allows Landorus-T to instantly counteract an Attack drop, commonly from Intimidate, Parting Shot from Incineroar, or Max Wyrmwind from Dragon-type Restricted Pokemon. Life Orb grants Landorus-T high immediate power; however, the damage output can drastically suffer when playing against double Intimidate cores. Lum Berry acts as a powerful safety net against Spore from Amoonguss, Sleep Powder from Venusaur, and Burning Jealousy from Incineroar and Torkoal, but it is weaker versus Intimidate and doesn't offer a power boost.

  • Landorus-T needs a Jolly nature to outrun Calyrex-S and Zacian-C after a Max Airstream boost.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description:
Yveltal's great bulk, good typing, and strong utility moves like Snarl and Foul Play make it a powerful Restricted Pokemon in the VGC 2022 metagame. It keeping both of the Calyrex formes in check and ignoring Prankster status moves, such as Thunder Wave from Grimmsnarl, add to its viability. Foul Play lets Yveltal take advantage of the high Attack stats of Restricted Pokemon, OHKOing Calyrex-I and Solgaleo while cleanly 2HKOing Zacian-C without bulk investment. It even 2HKOes some Zacian-C with lower Defense investment thanks to the boost from Dark Aura. Yveltal's immense special bulk with the Assault Vest and access to Snarl make it a good check to the ubiquitous Kyogre, and also to offensive Yveltal. Oblivion Wing is an invaluable tool to heal Assault Vest Yveltal, as well as 2HKOing Amoonguss. Sucker Punch allows for Yveltal KO Pokemon weakened by Foul Play or a Restricted partner, such as Zacian-C.

Zacian-C is an excellent ally Restricted Pokemon for Yveltal, as it takes care of opposing Yveltal, while Yveltal gets rid of Solgaleo and mitigates damage Zacian-C takes from special hits. It can also give Max Airstream boosts to Zacian-C. Incineroar and Grimmsnarl are invaluable partners to help Yveltal stay on the field for long and wittle longer, alongside helping it whittle down opposing teams in the face of threats such as Zacian-C and Regieleki. The Speed investment allows Yveltal to outspeed Zacian-C and Calyrex-S after a boost from Max Airstream. Special Attack investment and a Modest nature bump up its offensive presence, with 68 EVs in specific slightly optimizing the stat. The rest of the EVs are poured into bulk, preventing the 2HKO from Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade after Grimmsnarl's Reflect and Intimidate from Incineroar or Landorus-T. This spread also lets a Dynamaxed Assault Vest Yveltal survive Life Orb Regieleki's Max Lightning.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
Dark Aura and STAB give Yveltal a powerful Max Darkness after it Dynamaxes, which OHKOes or 2HKOes nearly the entire metagame. Oblivion Wing serves to enable Max Airstream to boost its and its allies' Speed. Its good Speed tier allows it to outrun maximum Speed investment Kyogre and Landorus-T, even when both have a beneficial nature, allowing allies such as Zacian-C to wreak havoc with Intrepid Sword-boosted Behemoth Blades. Heat Wave is mainly used to 2HKO Zacian-C regardless of its bulk investment. Life Orb boosts Yveltal's damage output to crazy levels, giving it a 50% chance to outright OHKO even bulky Zacian-C with Max Flare. This is particularly potent with Tailwind support from Whimsicott. Alternatively, Weakness Policy can be used on bulkier teams with dual screens support from Grimmsnarl or Regieleki, the latter of which can activate Weakness Policy with Volt Switch.

Zacian-C pairs excellently with offensive Yveltal, which can give it Speed boosts via Max Airstream and OHKO the likes of Solgaleo and physically defensive Incineroar, while Zacian-C in return deals with Grimmsnarl and opposing Yveltal. Incineroar serves to protect Yveltal from Zacian-C's and Calyrex-I's assaults. Amoonguss can be used to aid Yveltal against Dynamaxing Regieleki with Rage Powder and against Calyrex-I Trick Room teams with Spore. Landorus-T acts as a secondary Dynamax option and can help deal with sun teams, bringing Lum Berry, Max Airstream, and Intimidate against Groudon to boot.

Incineroar.overview: Incineroar is the metagame's best support Pokemon with invaluable utility moves like Fake Out and Parting Shot, as well as its defensive typing and Intimidate, which let it check many common Pokemon like Zacian-C, Calyrex-S, and Calyrex-I. Incineroar is especially valuable around Restricted Pokemon and Dynamax and Gigantamax users, as not only does it check the former, but it also supports them and other extremely powerful Pokemon like Gigantamax Charizard. Fake Out pins down foes for them, while Parting Shot pivots them in safely. Incineroar's good qualities are so valuable that it can fit on nigh any team and perform well.
Incineroar.comments:
Other Options

A maximum Speed and Attack EV set with a Jolly nature and Focus Sash is viable, allowing Incineroar to survive attacks from Pokemon it normally could not like Kyogre and Palkia, as well as giving it a faster Fake Out than most users like Rillaboom, most opposing Incineroar, and Grimmsnarl. Snarl is a fourth moveslot option that weakens special attackers like Dialga, Yveltal, and Kyogre switch-ins. Darkest Lariat, like Throat Chop, actiavtes Calyrex-S's Focus Sash, but it also has utility against Defense-boosting Pokemon like Max Steelspike Dialga, Solgaleo, and Groudon; however, Incineroar often will have better things to do than use a Dark-type attack, and Throat Chop's ability to block Parting Shot tends to make it more relevant.

sets.name: Bulky Utility
sets.description:
• Flare Blitz is necessary to slam Steel- and Grass-types like Zacian-C and Amoonguss.

  • Fake Out allows Incineroar to prevent a foe from moving, giving its teammates safer opportunities to set up or attack.

  • Parting Shot weakens a foe and lets Incineroar pivot its teammates in safely, the latter especially thanks to Incineroar's low Speed.

  • Throat Chop enormously damages Calyrex-S to the point of activating its Focus Sash, and it can block Parting Shot from opposing Incineroar.

  • Taunt shuts down status moves like Amoonguss's powder moves, Thundurus's and Grimmsnarl's Prankster-supported moves, and Calyrex-I's and Porygon2's Trick Room.

  • Burning Jealousy can severely punish Max Moves like Thundurus's Max Airstream, Groudon's Max Quake, and Solgaleo's Max Quake, and it is especially useful with Shuca Berry to better withstand Max Quake.

  • Shuca Berry is useful to withstand the metagame's bountiful Ground-type attacks from the likes of Landorus-T and Groudon. Sitrus Berry simply improves Incineroar's longevity. Safety Goggles gives Incineroar immunity to Amoonguss's and Venusaur's powder moves.

  • Defense investment helps with the metagame's powerful physical attackers like Zacian-C and Calyrex-I; 156 Defense EVs allow Incineroar to very consistently survive Zacian-C's +1 Sacred Sword. Maximum Speed investment is viable on teams with Tailwind to outpace Calyrex-S and Zacian-C. A specially defensive EV spread like 252 HP / 124 Def / 132 SpD with a Careful nature survives Life Orb Regieleki's Max Lightning and Calyrex-S's Max Quake.

sets.name: Dynamax Attacker
sets.description: Kartana's high Attack stat and access to great Max Moves make it an excellent addition to Kyogre teams, where it can remove Gastrodon from play and boost Kyogre's Speed with Max Airstream. Kartana works best as a late-game sweeper, KOing a weakened foe and gaining enough momentum withBeast Boost for it and its partner to sweep through the game. Kartana really needs all four of its coverage moves, as Smart Strike does the most damage to Zacian-C and Calyrex-I, Sacred Sword is necessary to hit Incineroar, and Aerial Ace—via Max Airstream—is essential for winning Speed wars against other common Dynamax users on opposing Kyogre teams like Thundurus, Tornadus, Landorus-T, and opposing Kartana. Max Knuckle from Sacred Sword also helps Kartana snowball through teams quickly, particularly if Zacian-C is in with Kartana to also gain the Attack boosts. White Herb and Life Orb help Kartana maximize its damage output, with the former cancelling out Intimidate and the latter giving it the strongest possible attacks while. Dynamaxed. Assault Vest is an option to patch Kartana's laughable Special Defense, though note that Assault Vest Kartana should use 244 Special Defense EVs to further weather special attacks.

sets.name: Miracle Seed
sets.description: Rillaboom is a great Pokemon in VGC 2022 with its powerful priority Grassy Glide KOing or heavily damaging common Water- and Ground-types like Kyogre, Gastrodon, and Groudon. Additionally, Rillaboom uses Fake Out to prevent a foe from moving and allow teammates safer opportunity in attacking or setting up. Miracle Seed grants Rllaboom a much appreciated power boost, allowing its priority Grassy Glide to pick off Pokemon like Groudon and Calyrex-S more easilyand OHKO many variants of bulky Kyogre. High Horsepower 2HKOes the very pertinent Zacian-C and has some usefulness while Gigantamaxed for Max Quake Special Defense boosts. Alternatively, Wood Hammer gives Rillaboom a more powerful Grass-type STAB move which nets OHKOes on bulky Kyogre through Reflect and Groudon and notably dents even resistant foes. Rillaboom doesn't often Gigantamax, but its G-Max Drumsolo is incredibly powerful and can OHKO even a Dynamaxed bulky Kyogre, and 2HKOes many Grass-resistant hyphen Pokemon. The EV spread survives Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade most of the time and outpaces maximum Speed Incineroar.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description: Strong priority Grassy Glide, targetting Ground- and Water-types like Groudon, Gastrodon, and Kyogre, makes Rillaboom a great Pokemon in VGC 2022. Fake Out is an invaluable support tool which shuts down a foe, allowing teammates opportunities to attack or set up. Assault Vest grants Rillaboom more resilience against special attackers like Kyogre and Calyrex-S, surviving Max Hailstorm and avoiding the 2HKO from Astral Barrage. High Horsepower 2HKOes the extremely common Zacian-C and while Gigantamaxed grants Rillaboom's team Special Defense boosts via Max Quake. Wood Hammer OHKOes bulkier variants of Kyogre which can survive Grassy Glide and Groudon. Knock Off is a decent option which hits Shedinja, Calyrex-S, and Lunala, though Rillaboom's other options tend to be more valuable. U-turn lets Rillaboom pivot powerful teammates like Kyogre and Zacian-C in safely. Rillaboom usually doesn't Gigantamax, but G-Max Drumsolo is a very powerful attack which OHKOes Dynamaxed Kyogre and heavily dents most resistant foes. The given EV spread lives Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade most of the time, OHKOes Kyogre without bulk investment via Grassy Glide, and outpaces maximum Speed Incineroar.

Grimmsnarl.overview: With Prankster, dual screens, speed control, and a typing that's useful for staving off the likes of Yveltal and Calyrex-S, Grimmsnarl is one of the best support Pokemon in VGC 2022, fitting on a wide variety of teams. Dual screens and speed control are even more valuable in a format with Restricted Pokemon and Dynamax, as they simply have more influence and effect with the higher power level. Grimmsnarl sees play on various different compositions such as Zacian-C + Kyogre, Groudon + Zacian-C, and Groudon + Lunala teams. Grimmsnarl can also run a Trick set that debilitates foes by giving them Iron Ball or Lagging Tail and taking away a useful item like Life Orb or Weakness Policy. Grimmsnarl is destroyed by the format's most relevant Restricted Pokemon, Zacian-C, which makes checks to Zacian-C such as Incineroar, Zapdos, Groudon, and Landorus-T good teammates.

sets.name: Dual Screens
sets.description:
• Spirit Break is generally Grimmsnarl's best STAB option, as it hits Yveltal, Palkia, and the Urshifu formes super effectively, and it has utility in weakening special attackers. Foul Play takes Calyrex-S down to its Focus Sash, deals sizable damage to physical attackers like Groudon, Landorus-T, and Calyrex-I, and, unlike Spirit Break, it doesn't activate Thundurus's Defiant.

  • Dual screens are especially great in a format with Dynamax and Restricted Pokemon, weakening the powerful attacks.

  • Scary Face and Thunder Wave are both fantastic speed control options; the former allows Grimmsnarl to slow down Electric- and Ground-types like Landorus-T, Regieleki, and Zapdos, while the latter persists through switching, has a full paralysis chance, and affects Solgaleo.

  • The given EV spread slightly optimizes Special Defense due to stat calculation quirks.

sets.name: Trick
sets.description:
• Spirit Break gives Grimmsnarl super effective coverage against the likes of Yveltal, Palkia, and the Urshifu formes, and it has utility in weakening special attackers. Alternatively, Foul Play brings Calyrex-S down to Focus Sash, deals significant damage to powerful physical attackers like Groudon, Landorus-T, and Calyrex-I, and hits Thundurus without activating Defiant. Foul Play is especially common alongside Iron Ball, as it allows Grimmsnarl to revenge kill Calyrex-I while Trick Room is up.

  • Trick takes away useful items like Zapdos's or Kyogre's Life Orb and saddles them with Iron Ball or Lagging Tail. Iron Ball immediately slows down targets and grounds Flying-types like Zapdos and Thundurus, allowing mainly Groudon to hit them with Ground-type attacks. Lagging Tail doesn't take effect until the turn after Trick, but it will make the target go last regardless of speed control options like Tailwind and Trick Room. Additionally, Trick plays around items that block Scary Face or Thunder Wave like Lum Berry on Charizard and White Herb on Landorus-T. Trick is especially good on teams weak to Thundurus, as it's immune to Thunder Wave and Scary Face triggers Defiant.

  • Reflect gets the nod over Light Screen, as reducing the damage output of Behemoth Blade is most important for Dynamaxed Pokemon, it is useful versus plenty of other physical attackers like Thundurus, Rillaboom, and Groudon, and it can be complemented by Max Quake users such as Groudon, Landorus-T, Calyrex-I, and Venusaur.

  • As Trick cannot affect Zacian-C and generally can only hamper one Pokemon, Grimmsnarl often runs another speed control option alongside it: Scary Face or Thunder Wave. The former affects Ground- and Electric-types like Regieleki, Zapdos, and Landorus-T, while the latter is permanent, can inflict full paralysis, and affects Solgaleo through Full Metal Body. If the team has sufficient speed control, Grimmsnarl can elect for Light Screen for the metagame's powerful special attackers like Kyogre, Palkia, and Yveltal.

  • The given EV spread slightly optimizes Special Defense due to stat calculation quirks.

Calyrex-Ice.overview: Calyrex-I is the strongest Ice-type in VGC 2022, boasting massive Attack and respectably solid bulk, which makes it an offensive juggernaut that's quite difficult to remove quickly. As One, its ability, has two great applications: shutting off resistance Berries like Yache Berry and Shuca Berry, ensuring it can't be stopped from picking up crucial KOs, and allowing it to quickly snowball through teams after a KO, something it can especially take advantage of with its signature spread move, Glacial Lance. Its high number of weaknesses makes it a great holder of Weakness Policy, though on the other hand, its pitiful two resistances combined with those six weaknesses greatly cut into its great natural bulk. Base 50 Speed is also incredibly slow, the slowest of any viable Restricted Pokemon in VGC 2022, which makes it reliant on Trick Room support from the likes of Mimikyu or Porygon2 to maximize its offensive capabilities. Additionally, Incineroar can give it a particularly rough time, switching into Glacial Lance and lowering its Attack with Intimidate.

sets.name: Trick Room Attacker
sets.description:
• Glacial Lance is a very safe move for Calyrex-I to use repeatedly, as most teams do not have many Pokemon resistant to Ice. Max Hailstorm is a useful way for Calyrex-I to disrupt opposing weather such as Groudon's sun or Kyogre's rain.

  • High Horsepower complements Glacial Lance very well, hitting the likes of Incineroar, Zacian-C, and Solgaleo. When Dynamaxed, Calyrex-I can OHKO most Incineroar with Max Quake if it didn't take an Intimidate Attack drop. The Special Defense boosts Max Quake accumulates are also very helpful for taking on strong special attackers like Kyogre and Regieleki.

  • While Calyrex-I is typically paired with a Trick Room-setting ally like Mimikyu or Porygon2, it is also an effective user of Trick Room itself thanks to its excellent bulk. It particularly thrives at getting late-game Trick Room up.

  • Weakness Policy pairs well with partners like Mimikyu and Dusclops, which can quickly activate it by hitting Calyrex-I with Shadow Sneak. The Attack boost counteracts Incineroar's Intimidate drops or achieves certain OHKOs, like Max Hailstorm OHKOing Charizard and Yveltal while they're Gigantamaxed or Dynamaxed. White Herb negates an Intimidate drop from Incineroar, which is often used to slow down Calyrex-I's onslaughts during Trick Room. Babiri Berry is primarily used to survive a +1 Behemoth Blade from Zacian-C.

  • A Brave nature with 0 Speed IVs is theoretically best for a Trick Room sweeper, though an Adamant nature with 31 Speed IVs is fine as well, since it will still underspeed neutral-nature Incineroar and attack it in Trick Room before being hit with Parting Shot.
